intro: Neobertiera, commonly known as the white sedge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plants are herbaceous perennials, typically found in wetland or marshy habitats. Neobertiera species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological roles in wetland ecosystems.
